page.title: 02NEW ROAD LINKS IN CHELMSFORD
page.content:
{The summer of 1985}sees a number of new roads being constructed through Chelmsford and its environs,in order to try to alleviate the town's traffic problems. The main 'bottleneck' on the A12 trunk route is at the{roundabout adjacent to {the Army & Navy}public house.Princes Road (built as a by-pass in 1932) meets the Baddow-Parkway flyover here. After many planning difficulties, a {new by-pass is being constructed around the town to the south and east.
The development of residential housing areas around the northern edge of the town({Chelmer Village,Newland's Spring {and North Springfield})has encouraged the building of a series of roads to link up the centre of the town (the {Chelmer Valley route}) with the new road networks there.
